definition: to fight/to struggle/to condemn/to censure/to contend/to put together/coming together

sentences.english: Ji Shengzi was celebrated for training fighting cock.
sentences.chinese: 紀渻子是有名的鬥雞訓練師。

sentences.english: Several boys try to catch a glimpse of a cockfight in the tannery section of the slums.
sentences.chinese: 幾個男孩正設法在貧民窟製革作坊裏看鬥雞。

sentences.english: The grass skiing area was next to the cock fighting place.
sentences.chinese: 鬥雞場的旁邊就是滑草場。

sentences.english: In North Viet Nam, the government allow people to hold cockfighting event to celebrate the New Year.
sentences.chinese: 在越南北部，政府允許人們舉辦鬥雞比賽來慶祝新年。

sentences.english: Game birds are very cannibalistic under any circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 鬥雞在任何情況下都是非常殘忍的。

sentences.english: People were fighting like gamecocks against adversity.
sentences.chinese: 一直都象鬥雞一樣地和艱難困苦奮鬥的人。

sentences.english: Send a new post about cockfighting in English.
The breed hasn't changed very much for over a thousand years.
sentences.chinese: 它是古代鬥雞的後代，在過去一千年裏，改變了很多。

sentences.english: There is the professional cockfighting website.
The first show was Python cockfighting.
sentences.chinese: 第一個表演是蟒蛇鬥雞。

sentences.english: His watery crossed eyes rolled in exaltation .
sentences.chinese: 他得意洋洋地轉動着水汪汪的鬥雞眼。

sentences.english: He does not have a cock-eye, but his actions are cock-eyed .
sentences.chinese: 他沒有鬥雞眼，不過，他的行動卻是愚昧的。

sentences.english: Cockscomb country is a god with chicken, but cockfighting always be defeated in big Long Guojin gallinaceous foot falls.
sentences.chinese: 雞冠國以雞爲神，但鬥雞總敗在大龍國金雞腳下。
他剪去鬥雞的雞冠和雞垂。

sentences.english: The cockfights, instituted by the mayor himself, were suspended.
sentences.chinese: 鎮長本人鼓勵的鬥雞停止了。

sentences.english: Banna gamecock is one of the famous cockfighting breed in China.
sentences.chinese: 版納鬥雞是我國著名的鬥雞品種之一。

definition: magnificent army with thousands of men and horses (idiom); impressive display of manpower/all the King's horses and all the King's men
bell made of copper or bronze
to move/to shift/to move out of the way/to divert (money etc) to a different purpose

Feast at Hongmen/(fig.) banquet set up with the aim of murdering a guest/refers to a famous episode in 206 BC when future Han emperor Liu Bang 劉邦|刘邦[Liu2 Bang1] escaped attempted murder by his rival Xiang Yu 項羽|项羽[Xiang4 Yu3]
Liuying township in Tainan county 台南縣|台南县[Tai2 nan2 xian4], Taiwan
lit. don't fight, won't make friends (idiom); an exchange of blows may lead to friendship/no discord, no concord
to amuse oneself/to play with/to tease
to present a treasure/to offer a valuable piece of advice/to show off what one treasures
vocal accompaniment in some traditional Chinese operas/to speak in support of/to chime in
